lines.Vitus: "So, I just thought of an idea..."
"...and then I decided it was an absolutely terrible one."
"So instead of that, how about we keep to ourselves today?"

lines.Volesus: "Sure thing. We have been through an awful lot today."

lines: ("Ha, if you mortals lack for company, then why did you not ask me earlier.?")

lines.Vitus: "Mukaki."

lines: (The two Crown Mages begin to whisper.)

lines.Volesus: "(...Why is he following us here, exactly?)"

lines.Vitus: "(Can he even touch the water without fizzling out?)"
"(Well, he looks like he's made of fire and lava, I don't know!)"
"(What if his body overheats the water and we get boiled alive?)"

lines.Mukaki: "What are the two of you scheming?"

lines.Vitus: "We were just discussing that it might be a bad idea for you to use the public bathhouse."

lines.Mukaki: "And why is that?"

lines.Vitus: "Well, ah-"
"The baths are a very orderly and traditional place."

lines.Volesus: "Much too stuffy for someone such as yourself."
"You would have to rent a little box for your clothes, then talk to the attendant to get a towel..."

lines.Vitus: "Absolutely not worth your time."

lines.Mukaki: "A towel? I am wearing plenty right now, but I can change if it would satisfy you."

lines: (We watch him walk over to one of the wicker bins containing the fresh towels.)

lines.Vitus: "Wait, is he really going through with this?"

lines.Volesus: "Well, I doubt Mukaki himself would be bothered by a line like "stealing bath towels is wrong"."

lines.Vitus: "I don't give a damn about the towels!"
"I don't want anybody getting boiled alive!"
"I don't intend to find out!"

lines.Mukaki: "You know, I can hear the both of you!"
"What a bunch of bullies, accusing me of that kind of stuff..."

lines.Vitus: "We're just being safe."

lines.Mukaki: "Oh ye of little faith..."
"Say uh... where exactly is the changing room?"

lines.Vitus: "Why do you care?"

lines.Volesus: "It's not like anybody else can see you but us."

lines.Mukaki: "...Okay, but you should both turn around."

lines.Vitus: "What?"

lines.Mukaki: "JUST BECAUSE I'M DIVINE DOESN'T MEAN I'M IMMODEST!"

lines.Vitus: "You're barely wearing anything in your ordinary outfit."

lines.Mukaki: "TURN AROUND!"

lines.Vitus: "...Okay."

lines.Mukaki: "...Phew."
"Now there's the kind of respect that I like to see."
"This won't take me long at all!"

lines: (We wait around for him to let us know that he's finished...)

lines.Mukaki: "There we go! You can turn around now!"

lines: (Mukaki was already wading around in the bath, splashing the water with one of his claws.)

lines.Vitus: "We must look mad to anybody who can see us."

lines.Volesus: "Forget about that, he didn't even change into anything!"
"He just dropped the towel on the floor and took off his armor."

lines.Vitus: "Y-You're right. Do you think we should mention it?"

lines.Mukaki: "The water's fine, mortals- get in already!"

lines: (Volesus tested the water tempature with his toe.)

lines.Vitus: "Wait! You'll still need your toe!"

lines.Mukaki: "Of course it's safe!"
"I wouldn't get anything out of cooking my loyal followers alive now, would I?"

lines.Vitus: "Who ever said we were your followers?"

lines.Mukaki: "Well, maybe not willingly."
"You mortals always think your decisions spring out of neatly curated conclusions, don't you?"
"You think you know how the world works, but everything you know is just made up by somebody else!"
"Every action and reaction you take pulls you into biases and dispositions that persuade you to act in one way or another."
"You're still responsible for your choices, of course, but things you can't control put you on that path."
"Take these oranges in the water, for example."

lines.Vitus: "What is he talking about, Volesus?"

lines.Mukaki: "It's not about the bloody fruit!"
"Look at how they all bob in the water."
"The tiniest ripple I make will set each orange on a course."
"The bodies collide and bump against one another, and each fruit is set on a course, seeting others on courses in return."
"You might think this is a peaceful little bathhouse, but chaos is at play constantly. For everybody, and for every thing."
"And that's why you're all my followers, whether you understand it or not."

lines.Vitus: "Huh."

lines.Mukaki: "Makes you think, right?"

lines.Vitus: "I wonder if these oranges are fresh enough to eat."
"It's not my fault he made me think about the oranges."

lines.Mukaki: "...Maybe I SHOULD boil the both of you alive."
